sub_concepts.name: Plate Boundaries
sub_concepts.definition: The boundaries where tectonic plates interact with each other, leading to various geological phenomena.

sub_concepts.name: Subduction Zones
sub_concepts.definition: Areas where one tectonic plate is forced underneath another plate, often leading to seismic activity and volcanic eruptions.

sub_concepts.name: Mid-Ocean Ridges
sub_concepts.definition: Underwater mountain ranges formed by tectonic plates moving apart, allowing magma to rise and create new oceanic crust.

sub_concepts.name: Plate Movements
sub_concepts.definition: The ways in which tectonic plates shift and interact, driving geological processes such as earthquakes and mountain formation.

sub_concepts.name: Continental Drift
sub_concepts.definition: The theory that continents have moved and shifted over time due to the movement of tectonic plates.
